encryptionAtRest.title: Manage encryption at-Rest
encryptionAtRest.enableEAR: Enable encryption at-Rest for this Universe
encryptionAtRest.rotateBothWarning: Rotating Master key and Universe key should be performed at different times.

editYSQLSettings.cannotEnableYSQL: You cannot enable YSQL after universe creation
editYSQLSettings.currentPwdToAuth: Enter current password to disable Auth
editYSQLSettings.updateSettingsSuccessMsg: Updating YSQL configuration is in progress
editYSQLSettings.rotatePwdSuccessMsg: DB credentials for YSQL updated successfully
editYSQLSettings.rotateBothYSQLWarning: Rotating YSQL Password and Editing YSQL settings should be performed at different times.
editYSQLSettings.disableYSQLWarning1: Are you sure you want to disable YSQL endpoint ?
editYSQLSettings.disableYSQLWarning2: Once you perform this operation, You cannot enable it again.

editYCQLSettings.currentPwdToAuth: Enter current password to disable Auth
editYCQLSettings.updateSettingsSuccessMsg: Updating YCQL configuration is in progress
editYCQLSettings.rotatePwdSuccessMsg: DB credentials for YCQL updated successfully
editYCQLSettings.rotateBothYCQLWarning: Rotating YCQL Password and Editing YCQL settings should be performed at different times.

encryptionInTransit.title: Manage encryption in-Transit
encryptionInTransit.enableEIT: Enable encryption in transit for this Universe
encryptionInTransit.useSameCert: Use the same certificate for “Node to Node” and “Client to Node” encryption
encryptionInTransit.enableCNAndNNEncryption: Enable “Node to Node” and “Client to Node” Encryption
encryptionInTransit.useRollingUpgrade: Use rolling upgrade to apply this change
encryptionInTransit.rollingUpgradeInputTitle: Set the upgrade delay between servers (Seconds)
encryptionInTransit.changeCTNCertWarning: Note! Changing the client to node root certificate may cause the client to loose connection, please update the certificate used in your client application.
encryptionInTransit.disableEncryptionWarning: Rotating certificates (Root Certificate or Server Certificate) and Enabling/Disabling encryption should be performed at different times.
encryptionInTransit.rootCAModifiedWarning: You have selected a new Certificates Authority for Node to Node encryption. Rotating a Certificates Authority will automatically rotate its associated Server Certificate.
encryptionInTransit.clientRootCAModifiedWarning: You have selected a new Certificates Authority for Client to Node encryption. Rotating a Certificates Authority will automatically rotate its associated Server Certificate.
encryptionInTransit.enableEITWarning: Enable Node to Node encryption or Client to Node encryption to enable encryption in transit.
encryptionInTransit.disableEITWarning: Note! Enabling/Disabling of “Encryption In Transit” or Enabling/Disabling of “Node to Node” or “Client to Node” encryption will be performed as non rolling upgrade.
encryptionInTransit.xClusterRotateCaWarning: Note! Rotating node to node CA certs for universes participating in an xCluster configuration as the source universe will interrupt the replication and require a restart of the xCluster configuration to resume replication after TLS rotation is completed.
encryptionInTransit.xClusterToggleEncryptionWarning: Note! Toggling on/off encryption for universes participating in an xCluster configuration will interrupt the replication. To enable replication again, please ensure all participating universes have matching TLS encryption setting and restart the affected xCluster configurations.

warning.title: Potential master failure detected
warning.threshold: Auto master failover will attempt to remediate in {{duration}}.
warning.runtimeConfigMsg: Auto master failover can be permanently disabled through the runtime config yb.auto_master_failover.enabled.

warning.title: Post auto master failover actions pending
warning.threshold: Post auto master failover actions will be attempted in {{duration}}.
warning.manualCleanup: Any underlying node failures need to be addressed manually through the Replace Node action.

helmOverrides.title: Kubernetes Overrides
helmOverrides.rollingUpgradeLabel: Rolling upgrade (upgrade pods one at a time)

dbRollbackUpgrade.additionalStep: An additional step is required based on the selected version.
dbRollbackUpgrade.additionalStepInfo: After the upgrade is completed, you'll need to manually finalize the upgrade to finish the process.
dbRollbackUpgrade.rolllingUpgradeLabel: Rolling upgrade (upgrade nodes one at a time)
dbRollbackUpgrade.rollingUpgradeMsg: Refers to the number of nodes that can be unavailable during upgrade process across AZs. This can possibly affect the performance of the cluster till the upgrade is finished
dbRollbackUpgrade.footerMsg1: Once the upgrade is finished, you can assess Universe performance and
dbRollbackUpgrade.footerMsg2: if any unusual behavior is detected.
dbRollbackUpgrade.rollbackPrevious: roll back to the previous version
dbRollbackUpgrade.xclusterWarning: This universe is part of one or more xCluster configurations. To minimize disruptions to these configurations during the upgrade process, you should, if possible, upgrade the target universe first.
dbRollbackUpgrade.rollbackModalMsg: Are you sure you wish to roll back to
dbRollbackUpgrade.rollbackOnenode: Rollback one node at a time
dbRollbackUpgrade.rollbackFailedMsg: The rollback of the Universe database upgrade has encountered an issue. To restore the Universe to its normal state, you can choose to either retry the rollback or get in touch our support team.
dbRollbackUpgrade.finalizeFailedMsg: The finalization of the Universe database upgrade has encountered an issue. To restore the Universe to its normal state, you can choose to either retry the finalization or get in touch our support team.
dbRollbackUpgrade.upgradeFailedMsg: The Universe database version upgrade has encountered an issue. To restore the Universe to its normal state, you have the option to either roll back the upgrade or retry the upgrade.
dbRollbackUpgrade.upgradeFialedNonRollback: The Universe database version upgrade has encountered an issue. To restore the Universe to its normal state,you can choose to either retry the upgrade or get in touch our support team.

preFinalize.rollback: Roll back to the previous version
preFinalize.bannerMsg1: Next Step: Evaluate the Universe and finalize the upgrade
preFinalize.bannerMsg2: You should now evaluate the universe performance.
preFinalize.bannerMsg3: If you are OK with the upgrade, click
preFinalize.modalTitle: One last reminder before we proceed...
preFinalize.modalMsg1: After the upgrade is finalized, you won't be able to roll back.
preFinalize.modalMsg2: Make sure you evaluate the universe performance before finalizing the upgrade.

preFinalizeXcluster.modalBody: This universe is associated with one or more xCluster replications. To avoid disrupting replication, you should upgrade all linked universes to version {{version}} before finalizing this universe or any linked universe.

pgCompatibility.subText: Configure YSQL for maximum Postgres compatibility by enabling early access features.
pgCompatibility.enableWarning: Note! Enabling enhanced Postgres compatibility requires a rolling restart of {{universeName}}. The universe will remain online and available throughout.
pgCompatibility.enableWarningRF1: Note! Enabling enhanced Postgres compatibility requires a restart of {{universeName}}. The universe won't be available for reads and writes during the restart.
pgCompatibility.disableWarning2: Requires a rolling restart of {{universeName}}. The universe will remain online and available throughout.
pgCompatibility.disableWarning1RF1: Note! Disabling enhanced Postgres compatibility requires a restart of {{universeName}} and may impact performance.
pgCompatibility.disableWarning2RF1: The universe won't be available for reads and writes during the restart.

analyzeModal.msg1: Enabling Enhanced Postgres Compatibility also enables the Cost Based Optimizer (CBO).
analyzeModal.msg3: on user tables after data load for the CBO to create optimal execution plans.

connectionPooling.subText: Enable built-in YSQL connection pooling to maximize the number of simultaneous connections to your database.
connectionPooling.enableWarningRF3: Note! Enabling built-in connection pooling requires a rolling restart of {{universeName}}. The universe will remain online and available throughout.
connectionPooling.enableWarningRF1: Note! Enabling built-in connection pooling requires a restart of {{universeName}}. The universe won't be available for reads and writes during the restart.
connectionPooling.disableWarning2RF3: Requires a rolling restart of {{universeName}}. The universe will remain online and available throughout.
connectionPooling.disableWarning3RF3: May reduce the number of simultaneous database connections and impact your application.
connectionPooling.disableWarning1RF1: Note! Disabling built-in connection pooling requires a restart of {{universeName}} and reduces the number of simultaneous database connections.
connectionPooling.disableWarning2RF1: The universe won't be available for reads and writes during the restart.
connectionPooling.overrideWarningRF3: Note! Editing connection pooling ports requires a rolling restart of {{universeName}}. The universe will remain online and available throughout.
connectionPooling.overrideWarningRF1: Note! Editing connection pooling ports requires a restart of {{universeName}}. The universe won't be available for reads and writes during the restart.

commonErrors.pageNotExist: Seems like this Page does not exist

encryptionAtRest.deleteConfigConfirmText: Are you sure you want to delete <0>{{configName}}</0> configuration?
encryptionAtRest.deleteConfigWarning: Before deleting this configuration make sure it's not being used by any backups. Note that in order to restore a backup with deleted KMS config <0></0> you'll need to create a new KMS config with the same master key details.

advancedConfig.enableIPV6Helper: Use IPV6 networking for connections between the DB servers.
advancedConfig.enableNetworkAccessHelper: Assign a load balancer or nodeport for connecting to the DB endpoints over the internet.
advancedConfig.title: Advanced Configuration
advancedConfig.pgSubText:
Configure YSQL for maximum Postgres compatibility by enabling
early access features. <1>Learn more
advancedConfig.pgTooltip: Access to enhanced Postgres compatible features is only available for database version 2024.2 or later. <1>Learn more</1>
advancedConfig.conPoolTooltip:
Use built-in YSQL service for maximizing the number of
simultaneous connections to your database.
advancedConfig.conPoolVersionTooltip: Built-in connection pooling is only available for database version 2024.2 or later.
advancedConfig.conPoolYSQLWarn: Enable YSQL first to use connection pooling.
advancedConfig.conPoolDBVersionWarn: Built-in connection pooling is only available for database version 2024.2 or later
advancedConfig.dbRPCPortTooltip:
Port for connecting to your application clients.
DEFAULT PORT : {{port}}
advancedConfig.ysqlConPortTooltip:
Port for connecting to the databases when connection pooling is enabled.
DEFAULT PORT : {{port}}

cloudConfig.mastersInDefaultRegionHelper: Forces placement of all masters in Default Region.

placementStatus.azWarning: Primary data placement is not geo-redundant, universe cannot survive even 1 availability zone failure
placementStatus.multiRegion: Primary data placement is fully geo-redundant, universe can survive at least 1 region failure
placementStatus.noFieldsChanged: At Least One Field Must Be Modified
placementStatus.regionWarning: Primary data placement is geo-redundant, universe can survive at least 1 availability zone failure
placementStatus.singleRF: Primary data placement is not redundant, universe cannot survive even 1 node failure

cloudConfig.title: Cloud Configuration
cloudConfig.colocatedModeHelper: Place Masters on the same nodes as T-Servers
cloudConfig.masterNumNodesHelper: Number of nodes dedicated to Masters is equal to the Universe’s replication factor and can not be modified.
cloudConfig.masterPlacementHelper: Select this option if you plan to use this universe for multi-tenancy use cases -or- you expect to create Databases with a very large number of tables

deleteClusterModal.deleteRRMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this read replica cluster ?
deleteClusterModal.enterUniverseName: Enter universe name to confirm delete:

gFlags.flagNotBelongError: This Flag does not belong to {{server}}. Remove Flag
gFlags.incorrectFlagMsg: Flag name is incorrect. Remove Flag
gFlags.JWKSModalTitle: Paste the JSON web key set (JWKS):
gFlags.JWKSModalNote: Note: You can obtain JWKS from JWKS URI that is part of OIDC discover end point
gFlags.noFlags: There are no flags assigned to this universe
gFlags.title: G-Flags
gFlags.inheritFlagsMsg: Apply the same Flags to primary cluster and Read Replica.
gFlags.rollingMsg: Apply all changes using a rolling restart (slower, zero downtime)
gFlags.nonRollingMsg: Apply all changes immediately, using a concurrent restart (faster, some downtime)
gFlags.nonRestart: Apply all changes which do not require a restart immediately;
gFlags.nonRestartRuntime: apply remaining changes the next time the database is restarted
gFlags.inheritRRModalBody:
Apply the same Flags to both Primary Cluster and Read replica?
This will override all the Flags that are currently applied to Read replica
by Primary Cluster’s Flag.
gFlags.inheritRRModalLine1: Apply the same Flags to both Primary Cluster and Read replica?
gFlags.inheritRRModalLine2: This will override all the Flags that are currently applied to Read replica
gFlags.inheritRRModalConfirmMsg: Are you sure you want to continue with the changes?
gFlags.validationError: Fix all the errors shown below to proceed
gFlags.invalidKey: Invalid attribute key or missing '=' between key value pair
gFlags.jwksNotSupported: Please select database versions 2.18 or above to upload JWKS
gFlags.missingAttributeValue: Missing value for the attribute key
gFlags.missingQuoteAttributeValue: Missing quotes or having spaces within attribute values
gFlags.hbaConfDescription: Input each record as a new row, then reorder them. The sequential order of the records are significant as they are searched serially for every connection request.
gFlags.pgConfDescription: CSV formatted line represented list of postgres setting assignments.
gFlags.identConfDescriptionSecond: Enter each mapping as a new row, comprising the map-name, external user name, and database user name.
gFlags.identConfDescriptionMore: To incorporate user name mappings from this flag, add them to the authentication methods that use external user names in hba_conf_csv file.
gFlags.flagsModifiedModalBody1: The Gflags has been modified in another tab/browser/device.
gFlags.flagsModifiedModalBody2: If you don't want to lose modified flags, please reload the page.
gFlags.flagsModifiedModalLine2: Note that current changes will be lost.
gFlags.rollingUpgradeMsg: Refers to the number of nodes that can be unavailable during upgrade process across AZs. This can possibly affect the performance of the cluster till the upgrade is finished
gFlags.pgGroupWarning: You can't change the disabled fields because it was set using the Enhanced Postgres Compatibility option

instanceConfig.assignPublicIPHelper: Assign a public IP to the DB servers for connections over the internet.
instanceConfig.dedicatedNodesHelper: Place tserver and master processes on separate nodes.
instanceConfig.ephemeralStorage: ! Selected instance type is with ephemeral storage, If you will pause this universe your data will get lost.
instanceConfig.premiumv2Storage: ! Selected storage type is only available in select regions. Your creation will fail if you choose incorrect region.
instanceConfig.title: Instance Configuration
instanceConfig.useTimeSyncHelper: Enable the {{provider}} Time Sync functionality for the DB servers.
instanceConfig.cooldownHours: Resizing device within cooldown period of 6 hours causes resize to happen only by moving to different nodes

authSettings.title: Authentication Settings
authSettings.enableYsqlOrYcql: Need to enable at least one endpoint among YSQL and YCQL
authSettings.enableYCQLHelper: Enable the YCQL API endpoint to run cassandra compatible workloads.
authSettings.enableYEDISHelper: Enable the YEDIS API endpoint to run REDIS compatible workloads.
authSettings.enableYSQLHelper: Enable the YSQL API endpoint to run postgres compatible workloads.

encryptionSettings.title: Encryption Settings
encryptionSettings.enableClientToNodeTLSHelper: Enable Client-to-Node encryption to use TLS enabled connection for communication between a client (ex: Database application, ysqlsh, ycqlsh) and the Universe YSQL -or- YCQL endpoint.
encryptionSettings.enableEncryptionAtRestHelper: Enable encryption for data stored on the tablet servers.
encryptionSettings.enableNodeToNodeTLSHelper: Enable Node-to-Node encryption to use TLS enabled connections for communication between different Universe nodes.

resizeNodeModal.modalDescription: This operation will be performed without restart

smartResizeModal.modalDescription: This operation will migrate this universe and all its data to a completely new set of nodes Or alternatively you could try smart resize (This will change VM image {{value}} for existing nodes)

placementModal.modalDescription: This operation will scale-up or scale-down the number of the nodes or will change master placement from colocated to dedicated or vice versa
placementModal.modalDescriptionRR: This operation will either scale-up or scale-down the number of the nodes or will change the configuration of number of read replicas

kubernetesPlacementModal.modalDescription: This operation shows the difference between old and new configuration for primary cluster
kubernetesPlacementModal.modalDescriptionRR: This operation shows the difference between old and new configuration for read replica cluster

fullMoveModal.modalDescription: This operation will migrate this universe and all its data to a completely new set of nodes.

validation.passwordStrength: Password must be 8 characters minimum and must contain at least 1 digit, 1 uppercase, 1 lowercase and one of the !@#$%^&* (special) characters.
validation.universeNameValidation: {{cloudType}} Universe name cannot contain capital letters or special characters except dashes

troubleshoot.startTimeError: Start Date is greater than end date
troubleshoot.tpServiceUrlHelperText: Please do not append '/' at the end of the URL
troubleshoot.registrationSuccess: Registered to Troubleshooting Platform service successfully
troubleshoot.registrationFailed: Failed to register to Troubleshooting Platform service
troubleshoot.tpConfigErrorMessage: Failed to fetch troubleshooting platform configuration

editDialog.title: Update Troubleshooting Platform Configuration
editDialog.updateMetadataSuccess: Successfully updated the Troubleshooting Platform configuration
editDialog.updateMetadataFailed: Failed to update the Troubleshooting Platform configuration
editDialog.tooltipMessage: The current troubleshooting platform service may be consumed by some universes currently, to update its metadata, please select the 'Force Update' checkbox

deleteDialog.title: Unregister Troubleshooting Platform Configuration
deleteDialog.unregistrationSuccess: Successfully unregistered from the Troubleshooting Platform service
deleteDialog.unregistrationFailed: Failed to unregister from the Troubleshooting Platform service
deleteDialog.tooltipMessage: Please unregister existing universes being monitored by the troubleshooting Platform service, if not, you can force unregister by checking the 'Force Unregister' checkbox
deleteDialog.unregisterMessage: Are you sure you want to unregister the Troubleshooting Platform service with URL: {{url}} ?

advisor.NoPerformanceIssues: Performance Advisor didn't find any performance issues
advisor.FailedToLoad: Failed to load. Try again later
advisor.ReviewLoadBalancing: If you are load balancing in your application or client, review your implementation.
advisor.ScanCluster: Scan the cluster for performance tuning recommendations
advisor.RunWorkload: For meaningful results, run your workload for at least 1 hour before doing a scan.
advisor.IndexPerformanceTuning: Learn more about index performance tuning
advisor.DropIndex: Connect to the database and use DROP INDEX to delete the unused indexes.
advisor.RangeSharding: Recreate the indexes using range sharding
advisor.DBScanFailed: Failed to scan the database. Try again later.

tooltip.universeUnavailable: This universe is currently unavailable for setting up further xCluster DR configs.

error.failToFetchUniverse: Error fetching details for the universe with the UUID: {{universeUuid}}
error.failToFetchDrConfig: Error fetching details for the DR config with the UUID: {{drConfigUuid}}
error.undefinedDrPrimaryUniverseUuid: The DR config does not have an associated DR primary universe.
error.undefinedDrReplicaUniverseUuid: The DR config does not have an associated DR replica universe

backupStorageConfig.currentStorageConfigInfo: <bold>{{storageConfigName}}</bold> will be used as the storage config for this operation. To use a different storage config, edit the DR config.
backupStorageConfig.missingStorageConfigInfo: There is no storage config associated with this DR config. Please add one by editing the DR config.

enableDrPrompt.featureDescription: Enable <bold>Active-Active Single-Master Disaster Recovery</bold> (DR) for near-zero recovery point objective (RPO) & recovery time objective (RTO) in the event of a universe outage.

tooltip.universeLinkedToTxnXCluster: This universe can't be used for disaster recovery as it is already participating in a transactional xCluster config.

banner.initializingDr: <bold>Initializing disaster recovery...</bold> Universe operations are not available while the operation is in progress.
banner.failoverInProgress: <bold>Failover in progress...</bold> Universe operations are not available while the operation is in progress.
banner.switchoverInProgress: <bold>Switchover in progress...</bold> Universe operations are not available while the operation is in progress.
banner.connectYourApps: <bold>Connect your applications</bold> to the new DR primary universe to direct read and writes to it.
banner.drConfigHalted: <bold>Warning!</bold> DR replication stream has been manually halted.
banner.drConfigRestartRequired: <bold>Warning!</bold> DR replication failed which means the DR replica is severely out-of-sync with the DR primary.

initiateModal.title: Switchover to DR Replica
initiateModal.titleTooltip: <paragraph>Switch the DR primary with the DR replica after waiting for replication drain so there will be no data loss.</paragraph>Replication drain allows the replication on the DR replica to catch up with the DR primary and be fully synchronized before initiating switchover.
initiateModal.instructions: Wait for the DR replica cluster to be fully synchronized with the primary by <bold>draining replication</bold> before switchover
initiateModal.noDataLoss: There will be <bold>no data loss</bold> in switchover.
initiateModal.switchoverConfirmation: Are you sure you want to switchover to <bold>{{drReplicaName}}</bold>?
initiateModal.confirmationInstructions: Enter DR replica universe name to confirm.

note.stopWorkload: <bold>Stop application workloads</bold> before initiating switchover as all <bold>writes will be rejected</bold> during switchover.

success.taskSuccess: Switchover completed. <universeLink><bold>{{sourceUniverseName}}</bold></universeLink> is now your DR primary.

abortModal.title: Abort Switchover
abortModal.description: Aborting switchover will revert the DR configuration to it's pre-switchover state.

initiateModal.title: Failover to DR Replica
initiateModal.description: Start failover immediately at the cost of <bold>losing some data</bold> that is not replicated to the DR replica.

estimatedDataLoss.label: Potential Data Loss
estimatedDataLoss.tooltip: The potential data loss is determined by the DR replica's safe time lag at the last known safe time.

initiateModal.failoverConfirmation: Are you sure you want to failover to <bold>{{drReplicaName}}</bold>?
initiateModal.confirmationInstructions: Enter DR replica universe name to confirm.

success.taskSuccess: Failover completed. <universeLink><bold>{{sourceUniverseName}}</bold></universeLink> is now your DR primary.

useExistingTargetUniverse.description: Create a full copy of {{sourceUniverseName}} on <bold>{{targetUniverseName}}</bold> to bring it up to the same checkpoint as your DR primary to re-establish the replication stream and have a DR replica available for failover.

backupStorageConfig.label: Backup Storage Config
backupStorageConfig.tooltip: <paragraph>Ensure that the backup storage config <bold>can be accessed from both source and target universe.</bold></paragraph><paragraph>Particularly, <bold>Network File System (NFS)</bold> based storage configs may not be accessible from universes in different regions.</paragraph>

useNewTargetUniverse.optionName: Select a new universe as DR replica

Halted.label: Halted
Halted.tooltip: The DR replication was halted during the failover as the DR replica is not in sync with the DR primary anymore due to the data loss during failover.

drStatus.label: DR status
drStatus.tooltip: Disaster Recovery (DR) utilizes asynchronous replication to ensure consistency between the primary and standby universe.

estimatedDataLoss.label: Potential data loss on failover
estimatedDataLoss.tooltip: If you would like to failover, this is the potential data loss measured in time. This estimated is determined by the DR replica's safe time lag at the last known safe time.

instruction.text: Select a universe to use as the DR replica
instruction.tooltip: <paragraph>The DR replica universe acts as a failover in case of a DR primary universe outage. It is asynchronously synchronized for high consistency.</paragraph><paragraph>Select a universe in a <bold>different region</bold> as a DR replica to survive potential region outages.</paragraph>

selectTargetUniverse.drReplicaSelectionHelpText: Make sure the DR replica has the right <drReplicaPrerequisiteDocsLink>prerequisites</drReplicaPrerequisiteDocsLink> for disaster recovery.
selectTargetUniverse.missingPermissionOnUniverse: This user does not have permission to set up xCluster DR with this universe.

error.mismatchedNodeToNodeEncryption: The source and target universe must have matching TLS enable/disable setting.
error.illegalCharactersInConfigName: The name of the DR configuration cannot contain any characters in [SPACE '_' '*' '<' '>' '?' '|' '"' NULL])

selectDatabases.instruction: Select the databases to enable disaster recovery for
selectDatabases.pitrSetUpNote: <bold>Note!</bold> Point-in-time Recovery will be enabled for the selected databases on the DR Replica.

configureBootstrap.instruction: Choose the storage config to use for performing the initial copy
configureBootstrap.infoText: Initial full copy is required when the database contains data. Performing an initial full copy requires a backup storage config as an intermediate third party storage, and is time and resource intensive. This is also referred to as bootstrapping or initial seeding.

backupStorageConfig.label: Backup Storage Config
backupStorageConfig.tooltip: <paragraph>Ensure that the backup storage config <bold>can be accessed from both source and target universe.</bold></paragraph><paragraph>Particularly, <bold>Network File System (NFS)</bold> based storage configs may not be accessible from universes in different regions.</paragraph>

retentionPeriodSeconds.label: Snapshot Retention Period
retentionPeriodSeconds.tooltip: A longer snapshot retention period requires more disk space.

confirmAlert.instruction: Confirm alert threshold for acceptable replication lag
confirmAlert.infoText: Replication lag measures how far behind in time the DR replica lags the DR primary. In a failover scenario, the longer the lag, the more data is at risk of being lost. To be notified if the lag exceeds a specific threshold so that you can take remedial measures, set a Universe alert for Replication Lag. <configureReplicationLagAlertDocLink>Learn More</configureReplicationLagAlertDocLink>
confirmAlert.currentLowestReplicationLagLabel: Lowest replication lag alert threshold on this DR primary universe ({{sourceUniverseName}}):
confirmAlert.setUpReplicationLagAlertPrompt: <paragraph>This DR primary universe does not have any replication lag alert configured. <manageAlertConfigLink>Configure an alert</manageAlertConfigLink></paragraph>

deleteModal.title: Remove Disaster Recovery
deleteModal.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to remove disaster recovery from <bold>{{currentUniverseName}}</bold>?
deleteModal.deleteConsequence: Your databases will no longer be replicated and there will be no DR replica universe to failover to in case of a disaster.
deleteModal.confirmationInstructions: Enter the current universe name to confirm.

editModal.title: Edit DR Configuration
editModal.infoText: Initial full copy is required when the database contains data. Performing an initial full copy requires a backup storage config as an intermediate third party storage, and is time and resource intensive. This is also referred to as bootstrapping or initial seeding.

selectTargetUniverse.missingPermissionOnUniverse: This user does not have permission to set up xCluster DR with this universe.

configureBootstrap.infoText: Initial full copy is required when the database contains data. Performing an initial full copy requires a backup storage config as an intermediate third party storage, and is time and resource intensive. This is also referred to as bootstrapping or initial seeding.

instruction.dr: Select the tables to enable disaster recovery for
instruction.xCluster: Select the tables to enable xCluster replication for

bootstrapSummary.instruction: Confirm full copy creation plan for newly added tables

error.fetchSourceUniverseDetailsFailure: Failed to fetch source universe details.
error.undefinedSourceUniverseUuid: The xCluster config does not have an associated source universe.
error.undefinedTargetUniverseUuid: The xCluster config does not have an associated target universe.

tooltip.universeUnavailable: This universe is currently unavailable for setting up further xCluster replication configs.
tooltip.universeLinkedToTxnXCluster: Another xCluster replication config cannot be configure as this universe is already participating in a transactional xCluster config.

infoPopover.title: Schema Change Mode
infoPopover.text: To make schema changes to databases with replication enabled, follow the <ddlChangeStepsDocsLink>steps in the docs in the right sequence</ddlChangeStepsDocsLink> that corresponds to your schema change mode.

ExtraTableOnSource.label: Extra Table On Source
ExtraTableOnSource.tooltip: This table is present on the {{sourceUniverseTerm}} but is not being replicated. Did you mean to add this to the set of tables in replication?

ExtraTableOnTarget.label: Extra Table on Target
ExtraTableOnTarget.tooltip: This table is present on the {{targetUniverseTerm}} but is not being replicated. Did you mean to add this to the set of tables in replication?

DroppedFromSource.label: Dropped From Source
DroppedFromSource.tooltip: This table is included in the {{xClusterOffering}} configuration but is missing on the {{sourceUniverseTerm}}. It needs to be dropped and removed from the {{xClusterOffering}} configuration.

DroppedFromTarget.label: Dropped From Target
DroppedFromTarget.tooltip: This table is included in the {{xClusterOffering}} configuration but is missing on the DR {{targetUniverseTerm}}. It needs to be dropped and removed from the {{sourceUniverseTerm}} configuration.

instruction.text: Select a universe to use as the target universe

selectTargetUniverse.missingPermissionOnUniverse: This user does not have permission to set up xCluster replication with this universe.
selectTargetUniverse.isTransactionalConfigTooltip: <paragraph>YBA support for transactional atomicity has the following constraints:<orderedList><listItem>The minimum YBDB version that supports transactional atomicity is 2.18.1.0-b1.</listItem><listItem>PITR must be enabled on the target universe.</listItem><listItem>Neither the source universe nor the target universe is a participant in any other xCluster configuration.</listItem></orderedList>You may find further information on this feature on our<xClusterDocLink> public docs.</xClusterDocLink></paragraph>
selectTargetUniverse.backupStorageConfigNote: <paragraph><bold>Note!</bold> If the tables to replicate are not empty on this source universe, ensure that the <bold> backup storage config can be accessed from both source and target universe </bold> for creating an initial full copy. Particularly, <bold>Network File System (NFS)</bold> based storage configs may not be accessible from universes in different regions. In that case, refer to the <ybAdminDocsLink>documentation for creating replication using yb-admin</ybAdminDocsLink>.</paragraph>
selectTargetUniverse.fullCopyNote: <bold>What is a full copy?</bold><paragraph>A full copy of your source universe is created to bring the target universe to the same checkpoint before turning on async replication. First, YBAnywhere creates a backup of the source universe. Then it restores the backup to the target universe. Hence the need to ensure the backup storage config is accessible from both source & target universe. If the tables selected for xcluster replication are empty on the source universe, no full copy creation is required.</paragraph>

warning.nonTxnXCluster: Warning: Non-transactional xCluster should only be used for bi-directional replication.

error.mismatchedNodeToNodeEncryption: The source and target universe must have matching TLS enable/disable setting.
error.illegalCharactersInConfigName: The name of the replication configuration cannot contain any characters in [SPACE '_' '*' '<' '>' '?' '|' '"' NULL])

instruction.ysql: Select the databases to enable xCluster replication for
instruction.ycql: Select the tables to enable xCluster replication for

error.requestFailureLabel: Create xCluster replication config request failed
error.taskFailure: Failed to create xCluster replication config.

banner.mismatchedTables: <bold>Warning!</bold> Database schema does not match across {{sourceUniverseTerm}} and the {{targetUniverseTerm}}. See the Tables tab for the list of problematic tables. DDL operations must be performed in a <ddlChangeStepsDocsLink>specified order</ddlChangeStepsDocsLink>.

confirmAlert.instruction: Confirm alert threshold for acceptable replication lag

infoText.xCluster: Replication lag measures how far behind in time the target universe lags the source universe. To be notified if the lag exceeds a specific threshold so that you can take remedial measures, set a Universe alert for Replication Lag. <configureReplicationLagAlertDocLink>Learn More</configureReplicationLagAlertDocLink>
infoText.dr: Replication lag measures how far behind in time the DR replica lags the DR primary. In a failover scenario, the longer the lag, the more data is at risk of being lost. To be notified if the lag exceeds a specific threshold so that you can take remedial measures, set a Universe alert for Replication Lag. <configureReplicationLagAlertDocLink>Learn More</configureReplicationLagAlertDocLink>

currentLowestReplicationLagLabel.xCluster: Lowest replication lag alert threshold on this source universe ({{sourceUniverseName}}):
currentLowestReplicationLagLabel.dr: Lowest replication lag alert threshold on this DR primary universe ({{sourceUniverseName}}):

setUpReplicationLagAlertPrompt.xCluster: <paragraph>This source universe does not have any replication lag alert configured. <manageAlertConfigLink>Configure an alert</manageAlertConfigLink></paragraph>
setUpReplicationLagAlertPrompt.dr: <paragraph>This DR primary universe does not have any replication lag alert configured. <manageAlertConfigLink>Configure an alert</manageAlertConfigLink></paragraph>

backupStorageConfig.instruction: Choose the storage config to use for performing the initial copy
backupStorageConfig.infoText: Initial full copy is required when the database contains data. Performing an initial full copy requires a backup storage config as an intermediate third party storage, and is time and resource intensive. This is also referred to as bootstrapping or initial seeding.
backupStorageConfig.label: Backup Storage Config
backupStorageConfig.tooltip: <paragraph>Ensure that the backup storage config <bold>can be accessed from both {{sourceUniverseTerm}} and {{targetUniverseTerm}} universe.</bold></paragraph><paragraph>Particularly, <bold>Network File System (NFS)</bold> based storage configs may not be accessible from universes in different regions.</paragraph>
backupStorageConfig.currentStorageConfigInfo: <bold>{{storageConfigName}}</bold> will be used as the storage config for this operation. To use a different storage config, edit the DR config.
backupStorageConfig.missingStorageConfigInfo: There is no storage config associated with this DR config. Please add one by editing the DR config.

upgradeModal.title: Upgrade Linux version
upgradeModal.infoContent:
Note!

The process of upgrading the Universe OS is time-consuming, as it involves upgrading one node at a time through a rolling upgrade approach. Each individual node upgrade consists of detaching the current boot disk, attaching a new boot disk, and then rebooting the node.

Throughout this entire process, no other Universe operations can take place, but your application will remain intact. It is advisable to upgrade during off-peak hours.
upgradeModal.sameVersionErrMsg: Universe is already using the imageBundle "{{image_name}}". Performing OS patching using it will result in no operation.
upgradeModal.verifyImageText: It is recommended to verify that the selected image can boot successfully on a standalone VM with the same instance type as the universe before initiating the upgrade.

settingsModal.submitLabel: Enable and Export Database Audit Log
settingsModal.title: YSQL audit log
settingsModal.mainMsg: Customize the YSQL statements, relations, and log settings logged using PostgreSQL Audit Extension (<1>pgAudit</1>). Database audit logging will add performance overhead, especially for verbose logs. <2>Learn more about YSQL audit logging</2>.
settingsModal.line1: Customize the YSQL statements, relations, and log settings logged using PostgreSQL Audit Extension
settingsModal.line2: Database audit logging will add performance overhead, especially for verbose logs.
settingsModal.learnMoreYSQlLog: Learn more about YSQL audit logging.
settingsModal.ysqlStatementTitle: 1. Select YSQL statements and relations to log
settingsModal.exportLogTitle: 3. Select a destination for the logs
settingsModal.confirmationDialogMsg: {{typeVal}} database audit logging requires a rolling restart of a universe {{universeName}}. The universe will remain online and available throughout.
settingsModal.leavePageModalTitle: You are about to leave this page

tooltips.logCatalog: Log statements for the PostgreSQL system catalog relations in pg_catalog. Disable this option to reduce noise in the log.
tooltips.logClient: Log messages directly to clients such as ysqlsh and psql for debugging. When enabled, you can set the level of logs that are output using pgaudit.log_client.
tooltips.logLevel: Set the severity level of logs displayed in clients when pgaudit.log_client is on.Will need to set an extra flag log_min_messages for all the severity levels to work. By default only LOG or WARNING will work without needing the flag log_min_messages
tooltips.logParameter: Include parameters passed with the statement. Parameters are provided in .csv format after the statement text.
tooltips.logParameterMaxSize: Maximum size, in bytes, of parameters to include. Parameters longer than this value are replaced with <long param suppressed>.
tooltips.logRelation: Create separate log entries for each relation (TABLE, VIEW, etc.) referenced in a SELECT or DML statement. This is a shortcut for exhaustive logging without using object audit logging.
tooltips.logStatement: Include the statement text and parameters.
tooltips.logStatementOnce: Statement text (and, if enabled, parameters) are included with every log entry. Enable this option to only include them with the first log entry for a statement or sub-statement combination. This results in less verbose logging, but can make it more difficult to determine the statement that generated a log entry.
tooltips.logRow: Include the rows retrieved or affected by a statement.
tooltips.exportLog: Forward audit log to your preferred 3rd party log management tool such as Datadog, Splunk, AWS CloudWatch, or GCP Cloud Logging. The audit logs are always available for download using the API regardless of whether export is enabled or otherwise.

dbAuitLog.exportNavDialogMsg: To create an export configuration for logs, navigate to Integrations > Log Export.
dbAuitLog.exportNavLink: Note! To export database audit logs to a third party tool, you need an export configuration in <1>Integrations > Log export.

exportAuditLog.emptyMsg1: Export logs and/or metrics to your preferred 3rd party monitoring tool.
exportAuditLog.emptyExportNote: Note: Audit logging requires additional resources and will impose performance overhead, especially for verbose audit logging.

OIDC.oidcUseRoleMapping: Use OIDC Groups for authentication and authorization

roles.title: Role Settings
roles.alertText: To map OIDC groups to YugabyteDB Anywhere roles, go to the Groups tab
roles.groupOverrideWarning: Note: Turning this ON will override roles previously assigned to individual users

OIDCMetadataModal.title: Add OIDC Provider Configuration
OIDCMetadataModal.helpText:
Paste the content of your identity provider's OIDC configuration document (in JSON format) into the field below.

The document contains key-value pairs with details about the OIDC provider's configuration, including all necessary endpoints and public key location information. Learn More

infos.clientID: The unique identifier of your manually created client application in the Identity Provider
infos.clientSecret: The password or secret for authenticating your Yugabyte client application with your Identity Provider
infos.discoveryURL: Endpoint that validates all authorization requests. This can be found in discovery document
infos.emailAttribute: Scope containing email ID of the user
infos.refreshTokenURL: Provide the endpoint that will be used for re-fetching the access token
infos.defaultRole: The "Default Role" sets privileges for users who are not explicitly registered in YugabyteDB Anywhere
infos.defaultRoleHelpText: When off, OIDC individual users are used for role authentication
infos.readOnly: The "Read Only" role allows users to log in and provides read-only privileges
infos.connectOnly: The "Connect Only" role allows users to log in and edit their own profile
infos.groupClaim: Provide the claim keyword in a user's OIDC ID token that contains the list of the user's OIDC groups
infos.jwtTokenURL: Option to display button to retrieve the JWT token

LDAP.title: LDAP Configuration
LDAP.groupMemeberAttribute: Attribute that will be used to find the list of groups that is a member of
LDAP.groupSearchFilter: Filter to find all groups that a user belongs to
LDAP.ldapUseRoleMapping: Map YugabyteDB Anywhere built-in roles to your existing LDAP groups

infos.ldapURL: LDAP URL must be a valid URL with port number, Ex:- 0.0.0.0:0000
infos.ldapSecurity: Configure the LDAP server connection to use LDAPS (SSL) or LDAP with StartTLS (TLS) encryption
infos.tlsProtocol: Configure the TLS Protocol Version to be used in case of StartTLS or LDAPS
infos.ldapBaseDN: Base of the DN for LDAP queries. Will be appended to the user name at login time to query the LDAP server
infos.ldapDNPrefix: LDAP DN Prefix will be set to CN= by default if not provided
infos.customerUUID: Unique ID of the customer in case of multi-tenant platform
infos.searchAndBind: Mechanism used to bind to the LDAP server
infos.searchAttribute: Attribute that will be used to search for the user in the LDAP server
infos.searchFilter: Filter that will be used to narrow down the search for the user inside specific LDAP groups. Either search attribute or filter should be specified.
infos.serviceAccountName: Bind DN will be used to login to the service account
infos.connectOnly: Users with ConnectOnly role cannot see any information other than their own profile information
infos.groupSearchFilter:
Use {username} to refer to the user CN
Example: (&(objectClass=group)(member=CN={username},OU=Users,DC=yugabyte,DC=com)
infos.groupSearchBaseDN: Base DN used to search for user group membership

generalSettings.helpText: This cannot be changed after policy creation
generalSettings.unsatisfiedNodes: Warning! This config does not have buckets for all regions that this universe has nodes in. This will lead to increased costs due to cross region data transfer and can result in violations related to data handling such as gdpr

backupObjects.selectDBTitle: Select the Keyspaces/Databases you want to backup
backupObjects.backupTablespaceSubText: In Universes using tablespaces, this allows restoring while preserving source universe tablespaces. (Given both source and target have the same topology.)
backupObjects.allTables: Select all tables in this Keyspace

errMsg.selectedTables: Atleast one table should be selected

standard.title: Standard backup
standard.helpText:
• Restorable to the creation time of full & incremental backups
  • No additional disk storage required

pitr.title: Backup with ability to restore to point-in-time
pitr.helpText:
• Restorable to any point in time from the first backup to the last backup
  • Requires additional disk storage. Learn More

backupFrequencyField.title: Set backup frequency
backupFrequencyField.takeIncrementalBackups: Take incremental backups within full backup intervals
backupFrequencyField.incrementalBackupHelpText: For continuous point-in-time restore, interval must be 24 hours or less.

errMsg.frequency: Interval should be greater than an hour
errMsg.expiryTime: Duration must be greater than or equal to one
errMsg.incrementalBackupFrequency: 'Incremental backup interval must be less than full backup'
errMsg.incGreaterThan: Incremental backup should be greater than {{min}} minutes

backupSummary.title: Summary
backupSummary.name: Name
backupSummary.Point-in-time: Backup with ability to restore to point-in-time
backupSummary.backupWillStart: Note: The next scheduled backup will start shortly following the creation of this policy
backupSummary.helpText:
We recommend performing an on-demand backup prior to executing any DDL changes between backup intervals to prevent data loss.
Learn more
backupSummary.successMsg: Scheduled backup policy is being created. A backup will begin shortly.
backupSummary.errorMsg: Unable to created scheduled backup policy

errMsg.parallelThreads: Parallel threads should be between 1 and 100

list.deleteMsg: scheduled backup policy is being deleted

editModal.title: Edit Scheduled Backup Policy

source.selectKeyspace: Select the keyspace(s) you want to restore
source.restoreBetweenMsg: You may restore to any time between and
source.helpText: Note: if a DDL change occurred in any keyspaces(s) from this backup, choose a timestamp between the time of the DDL change and . Learn more

target.selectUniverse: Select a universe to restore to
target.forceRenameHelpText: Note! Renaming is required since the selected target universe contains keyspaces with identical names. You will be able to rename in step 3.
target.restoreTablespaces: Restore tablespaces and data to their respective regions
target.restoreTablespacesHelpText: Note! If you don't select this option, or the target universe doesn't have a matching topology, all data will be restored to the primary region.
target.kmsConfigHelpText: Note! For a successful restore, the KMS configuration used for restore should be the same KMS configuration used during backup creation.

validationErrMsg.keyspacesAlreadyExists: Keyspace already exists in the target Universe
